conclusion: To determine if objects A and B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze their velocity-time graphs.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, which can be determined from the slope of the velocity-time graph.
The slope of the velocity-time graph at any point gives the acceleration at that point.
For object A, the slope at \( t_1 \) is the tangent to the curve at that point.
For object B, the slope at \( t_1 \) is the tangent to the curve at that point.

conclusion: At \( t_1 \), observe the steepness of the tangent lines for both objects.

conclusion: If the slopes are equal, the accelerations are the same.
